WorkItem.Description:
I'm dealing with BIFF8 documents generated by some proprietary accounting application (which is ubiqutous in Russia) and it seems in these documents the "last existing row" field from the "worksheet index" record is bogus and is less than the (correct) number available via the "dimensions" worksheet record.
 
While this can be viewed as the mentioned program violating "the specification", native Microsoft software and OpenOffice/LibreOffice have no problem dealing with these files so I'm inclined to think we should use the max available row number from that "dimensions" sheet record if it's available.
 
The attached patch contains the proposed fix.
WorkItem.Summary: Incorrect detection of the last row for certain BIFF8 files

Comments.Message: Forgot to add that the patch is made against revision 59893.

Associated with changeset 82640: applied patch, but had to modify it to use  (int)dims.LastRow instead of (int)dims.LastRow - 1 . Was unable to recreate exact issue in a unit test but this patch seems valid and existing tests all pass
Can you try this latest version with one of your documents?
